Meanwhile, J.D. gets stuck with a patient, whose diagnosis he can't quite pin down, and when Dr. Cox denies him any assistance, he looks to Carla and Turk to help him out. While Dr. Cox is busy not helping J.D., he takes the time to make amends with Dr. Kelso.
episodes.title: My Own American Girl

episodes.label: 3x02. My Journey
episodes.plot:
J.D. is feeling left out of his friendship with Turk and gets hurt when Turk is scared of opening up to him.
Meanwhile, Carla is driven crazy over an unidentified urine sample, and Elliot tries to balance Sean and her career, so that one doesn't end up getting in the way of the other.
episodes.title: My Journey

episodes.label: 3x03. My White Whale
episodes.plot:
Finding difficulties training his interns, J.D. asks to Elliot for some help. She tells J.D. about Sean, who gave Elliot great tips based on his dolphin training that fit perfectly for her interns.
Dr. Cox finds the ideal pediatrician for his son: Dr. Norris, who acts and looks just like him. However, Dr. Cox is quick to find a problem with him once Jack develops a cough that scares both him and Jordan.
episodes.title: My White Whale

episodes.label: 3x04. My Lucky Night
episodes.plot:
Sean is a bit surprised and disturbed to learn about Elliot and J.D.'s history together, but it turns out his anger is really a cover up for his upcoming six month long trip and he doesn't want Elliot to explode.
Dr. Cox. is forced to swallow his pride and actually ask for help when he decides to throw his hat in the ring for the Residency Director position at the hospital.
Carla picks up an extra shift as a surgical nurse, which allows her to spend the day working alongside with Turk, to his great annoyance.
episodes.title: My Lucky Night

episodes.label: 3x05. My Brother, Where Art Thou?
episodes.plot:
Dan decides to stay with J.D. for a while after their mom's new fiancé kicks him out, but after spending some quality time with him at the hospital, Dan isn't sure if he likes the cynical person his little brother has become.
Elliot tries to deal with her own problems of a long distance relationship and decides to try moonlighting as a pet examiner with Carla to save up money.
episodes.title: My Brother, Where Art Thou?

episodes.label: 4x01. My Old Friend's New Friend
episodes.plot: The new Dr. Clock arrives with her spaced out personality and doesn't cease to call J.D. "Johnny." But J.D. is fine with it, because there is nothing that is going to bring down his last week of being a resident before he officially becomes a full fledged doctor.
episodes.title: My Old Friend's New Friend

episodes.label: 4x02. My Office
episodes.plot:
Dr. Clock tries to reconcile J.D. and Eliot, while waiting to see which one Dr. Cox will give the Chief Resident position to. Molly and Carla are experiencing some subtle conflict and Elliot and J.D. begin to come together after long bouts of conflict of their own.
Meanwhile, Dr. Cox, Turk and the Janitor are forced to work together to help a patient.
episodes.title: My Office

episodes.label: 4x03. My New Game
episodes.plot:
Dr. Cox is having issues with Jordan, since Ted revealed that they are still technically married due to some filing problems.
J.D. has problems of his own as he can't shake off the tag of Co-Chief Resident the Janitor assigned to him, while Elliot keeps the Chief Resident tag.
Elsewhere, Turk begins to doubt his abilities after letting a patient die and isn't helped, when he finds out J.D. has no confidence in him either.
Dr. Cox and Molly spar about her involvement in his patients.
episodes.title: My New Game

episodes.label: 4x04. My First Kill
episodes.plot:
J.D. is shocked to hear Dr. Cox tell his interns that eventually, they will screw up and kill a patient. J.D. fears his first time killing someone will soon be upon him.
Elliot is upset with Molly, after she disagrees about a patient's promise to attend drug rehab.
Carla loses Rowdy and she and the Janitor go looking for him.
episodes.title: My First Kill

episodes.label: 4x05. Her Story
episodes.plot:
Elliot becomes unsure, if she wants Molly as her mentor, when she finds out that Molly doesn't have a perfect home life.
J.D. is tested in leadership skills when Dr. Cox yells at him in front of his interns.
Carla and Turk try to come to an agreement when Turk continuously wakes Carla up every night.
episodes.title: Her Story

episodes.label: 1x01. Minimum Viable Product
episodes.plot: Attending an elaborate launch party, Richard and his computer programmer friends - Big Head, Dinesh and Gilfoyle - dream of making it big. Instead, they're living in the communal Hacker Hostel owned by former programmer Erlich, who gets to claim ten percent of anything they invent there. When it becomes clear that Richard has developed a powerful compression algorithm for his website, Pied Piper, he finds himself courted by Gavin Belson, his egomaniacal corporate boss, who offers a $10 million buyout by his firm, Hooli. But Richard holds back when well-known investor Peter Gregory makes a counteroffer.
episodes.title: Minimum Viable Product

episodes.label: 1x02. The Cap Table
episodes.plot: After a celebratory party at the Hacker Hostel, Richard and Erlich learn that Peter Gregory won't pay up until they deliver a viable business plan that includes a slimmed-down staff. A desperate Richard hires former Belson underling Jared, and they set about trying to trim the fat. While Gilfoyle and Dinesh prove essential, Big Head's place in the company is less certain.
episodes.title: The Cap Table

episodes.label: 1x03. Articles of Incorporation
episodes.plot: While Gavin Belson begins to hype Nucleus, a competing compression platform, Richard learns that the name Pied Piper is already registered to a sprinkler company, forcing him to negotiate. Meanwhile, Erlich goes on a vision quest for a new company name, and Peter Gregory proves elusive when one of his companies asks for money.
episodes.title: Articles of Incorporation

episodes.label: 1x04. Fiduciary Duties
episodes.plot: At Peter's toga party, Richard drunkenly promises to make Erlich a board member, which he regrets the next morning. After being unassigned at Hooli, Big Head finds others like him who have made careers out of doing nothing. Richard struggles to put Pied Piper's vision into words for a presentation without Erlich; later, he discovers an interesting connection between Peter and Gavin Belson.
episodes.title: Fiduciary Duties

episodes.label: 1x05. Signaling Risk
episodes.plot: Erlich taps a graffiti artist to design Pied Piper's logo, with predictably controversial results. Meanwhile, Richard learns he doesn't have much time to prepare for a live demonstration at TechCrunch Disrupt; Gavin Belson and Peter Gregory have an unexpected encounter; and Jared works on the company's efficiency.
episodes.title: Signaling Risk

episodes.label: 2x01. Sand Hill Shuffle
episodes.plot: Following their success at TechCrunch Disrupt, the guys of Pied Piper find themselves aggressively courted by every VC in Silicon Valley. With Peter Gregory’s company facing major changes, Monica tries to do what’s best while dealing with new managing partner Laurie, a competitive bigwig who will do anything to hold onto Pied Piper. Later, Richard makes a decision about the company’s future and faces big news from Hooli.
episodes.title: Sand Hill Shuffle

episodes.label: 2x02. Runaway Devaluation
episodes.plot: In the wake of Hooli’s bombshell, Richard and the guys struggle to find a backer as they face legal and financial woes. Monica attempts to balance her interest in Pied Piper with her job. A cash-strapped Dinesh tries to put an end to the Kickstarter campaign for his cousin’s new app, Bro. Richard gets a surprising offer.
episodes.title: Runaway Devaluation

episodes.label: 2x03. Bad Money
episodes.plot: While considering Gavin’s proposal, Richard is approached by Russ Hanneman, an image-conscious billionaire who wants to back Pied Piper, but may not be as “hands-off” as he claims. Gilfoyle and Dinesh play hardball to get what they want; Gavin finds a new strategy in dealing with the enemy.
episodes.title: Bad Money

episodes.label: 2x04. The Lady
episodes.plot: Richard butts heads with Erlich over a prospective hire, while Dinesh and Gilfoyle become suspicious that a new employee they recommended is commanding a higher salary. Big Head gets a surprising promotion at Hooli. At a board meeting, Monica and Richard find themselves outvoted; Jared institutes a workplace harassment policy.
episodes.title: The Lady

episodes.label: 2x05. Server Space
episodes.plot: Gavin’s interference causes Pied Piper to struggle with securing their expansion, while a nosy neighbor puts the guys at risk. Gilfoyle takes on the task of building servers, and an overstressed Richard reluctantly takes in Jared as a roommate. Big Head’s management skills are questioned, and Nucleus’ debut zeroes in on a big event.
episodes.title: Server Space

episodes.label: 3x01. Founder Friendly
episodes.plot: After being unceremoniously fired, an angry Richard faces a tough decision: accept the diminished role of CTO, or leave Pied Piper for good. Erlich takes a shine to Jack Barker, Laurie’s new choice of CEO, while Dinesh and Gilfoyle weigh their options in Richard’s absence. At Hooli, Gavin tries to improve his image by admitting failure, and Big Head gets wind of major changes.
episodes.title: Founder Friendly

episodes.label: 3x02. Two in the Box
episodes.plot: The new and improved Pied Piper impresses Dinesh and Gilfoyle, but worries Richard; Jared and Erlich both face housing issues; Gavin suggests a controversial move.
episodes.title: Two in the Box

episodes.label: 3x03. Meinertzhagen's Haversack
episodes.plot: Richard searches for a way around Jack. Gilfoyle opens himself up to recruiters. Dinesh draws unwanted attention from a recent purchase.
episodes.title: Meinertzhagen's Haversack

episodes.label: 3x04. Maleant Data Systems Solutions
episodes.plot: The Pied Piper guys struggle to phone it in. Erlich faces competition. Monica takes a stand. Gavin makes a decision about Nucleus.
episodes.title: Maleant Data Systems Solutions

episodes.label: 3x05. The Empty Chair
episodes.plot: Richard lets his ego get in the way at an interview. Dinesh, Gilfoyle and Jared misplace hardware. Erlich pitches his plans to Big Head.
episodes.title: The Empty Chair

episodes.label: 1x01. Cartman Gets an Anal Probe
episodes.plot: While the boys are waiting for the school bus, Cartman explains the odd nightmare he had the previous night involving alien visitors abducting him from his bed. Meanwhile Kyle and Stan try to convince Cartman that the dream was in fact a reality.
episodes.title: Cartman Gets an Anal Probe

episodes.label: 1x02. Weight Gain 4000
episodes.plot: Mr. Garrison starts the day off with a special announcement; one of South Park's own has won a national essay contest. Everyone is shocked to learn that the winner is Cartman, who doesn't even remember what he wrote about.
episodes.title: Weight Gain 4000

episodes.label: 1x03. Volcano
episodes.plot: The boys get together with Stan's Uncle Jimbo and Jimbo's war-buddy Ned for a hunting trip in the nearby mountains. After Cartman's mom makes sure her "little" boy is safe and sound (much to Cartman's dismay) the group heads off for adventure. As they drive away from the town, Jimbo explains the "finer" points of hunting.
episodes.title: Volcano

episodes.label: 1x04. Big Gay Al's Big Gay Boat Ride
episodes.plot: Stan's got a new dog-named Sparky. Stan proclaims his pet to be the toughest dog on the mountain. Though while Stan thinks his dog is ready for fighting, Sparky proceeds to hump Sylvester like a little bitch. The other boys taunt Stan about his gay dog and Sparky runs away to find someone who will love him for who he is.
episodes.title: Big Gay Al's Big Gay Boat Ride

episodes.label: 1x05. An Elephant Makes Love to a Pig
episodes.plot: Stan notices a new addition in their bus stop crew, an elephant standing alongside Kyle. At school, class lessons for the day involve genetic engineering (conveniently enough). Kyle questions the possibility of a genetically engineered elephant made smaller by design. The boys have to beat the rough kids in their genetics experiment, and will try anything to do it.
episodes.title: An Elephant Makes Love to a Pig

episodes.label: 2x01. Terrance & Phillip in 'Not Without My Anus'
episodes.plot: The show starts off with the build up from last season's cliffhanger revolving around Cartman's paternal origins. However, just as it seems they are about to get on with the second half of "Cartman's Mom Is A Dirty Slut," they do a 180 degree turn-around and reveal that for April Fool's Day they will be showing Terrance & Phillip in "Not Without My Anus."
episodes.title: Terrance & Phillip in 'Not Without My Anus'

episodes.label: 2x02. Cartman's Mom is Still a Dirty Slut
episodes.plot: Dr. Mephisto is about to reveal who Eric Cartman's father really is! Glass shatters and gunshots ring out. A mysterious assailant apparently shot Mephisto while the lights were off. Much to Eric's chagrin, they rush Mephisto off to the hospital. Chef rushes out the door with Mephisto in hand. They must fight against time to learn Eric's background, who is his father? Where does he come from?
episodes.title: Cartman's Mom is Still a Dirty Slut

episodes.label: 2x03. Ike's Wee Wee
episodes.plot: Ike's going to have a Briss and everyone is invited! Stan, Kenny, and Cartman find out what a Briss really is and try to warn Kyle that his parents are going to cut off Ike's wee wee. Kyle sends Ike away to protect him from his scissor wielding parents.
episodes.title: Ike's Wee Wee

episodes.label: 2x04. Chickenlover
episodes.plot: The Booktastic bus is in town and soon everyone finds out that Officer Barbrady can't read. He is whisked off to school with the boys so he can save his job. While he's there someone in South Park is having sex with the town's chickens and only Officer Barbrady with his new deputies Kenny, Kyle, Stan, and Cartman can stop them!
episodes.title: Chickenlover

episodes.label: 2x05. Conjoined Fetus Lady
episodes.plot: Kyle is injured and must go to see the school nurse and is terrified because of the stories he's heard. She looks fairly normal, except for the dead fetus sticking out of her head. Kyle's mother educates the boys on her "condition" and decides that everyone in South Park should be made aware. Meanwhile, the South Park Cows dodgeball team goes to the state, national and finally the international finals in China.
episodes.title: Conjoined Fetus Lady

episodes.label: 3x01. Rainforest Shmainforest
episodes.plot: Mr. Mackey punishes the boys by forcing them to join the "Getting Gay With Kids" choir. The choir is going to Costa Rica to help save the rainforest. While on a tour of the rainforest the choir group gets lost when a snake kills their guide. They soon discover the evils of the rainforest, which changes the choir group's message.
episodes.title: Rainforest Shmainforest

episodes.label: 3x02. Spontaneous Combustion
episodes.plot: Kenny spontaneously combusts. The mayor asks Randy Marsh to find a solution. The boys try to help Kyle's dad to get an erection. One way they think they can help is by performing the Stations of the Cross at church crucifying Cartman and waiting three days for his res-erection. Randy Marsh figures out the reason everyone is combusting is because they are withholding their farts.
episodes.title: Spontaneous Combustion

episodes.label: 3x03. The Succubus
episodes.plot: Kyle and Stan try to rescue Chef from the clutches of the Succubus that he is going to marry. Meanwhile, Cartman deals with his eye problems and the optometrist he doesn't like. Chef's Mama and Papa appear for the first time.
episodes.title: The Succubus

episodes.label: 3x04. Jakovasaurs
episodes.plot: The boys discover a live prehistoric Jakovasaur while camping on Stark's Pond. The government and the citizens of South Park are interested in trying to help keep this endangered species alive, until they all realize how annoying the Jakovasaurs really are. The only one who really enjoys them is Cartman. The boys try distracting him while the town tries to send the Jakovasaurs to France.
episodes.title: Jakovasaurs

episodes.label: 3x05. Tweek vs. Craig
episodes.plot: The boys take Shop class and try to set-up a fight between Tweek and Craig. Kenny is delighted in safely taking the Home Economics course. When the big fight arrives, the combatants don't know what to do; so Jimbo and Ned teach Tweek boxing and Cartman has Craig instructed in the art of Sumo. Shop teacher Mr. Adler has a recurring dream about a woman that he was never able to say goodbye to.
episodes.title: Tweek vs. Craig

episodes.label: 4x01. The Tooth Fairy Tats 2000
episodes.plot: The tooth fairy has visited Cartman, leaving him two dollars. He rushes to the bus stop to share his news with the others. He then unveils his latest plan. If all they all combined their lost teeth, the tooth fairy will provide them with enough cash to purchase a Sega Dreamcast. They soon find out that they are treading on someone else's territory. Now they have to work with the mobsters to keep their manhood.
episodes.title: The Tooth Fairy Tats 2000

episodes.label: 4x02. Cartman's Silly Hate Crime 2000
episodes.plot: The kids have just won a sledding race. Token says that the only reason they won is because of Eric's fat ass. The girls challenge the boys to a sledding race down Phil Collins Hill. Token says that the boys can't lose thanks to Eric's fat ass. Eric then tosses a rock into the side of Token's head. The FBI claim that this was a hate crime and Cartman is sent to jail. Can the other boys bust Cartman out in time for the big race?
episodes.title: Cartman's Silly Hate Crime 2000

episodes.label: 4x03. Timmy 2000
episodes.plot: There's something wrong with new student Timmy. About the only thing Timmy can do is say his name. Ignorant of the fact that Timmy is "retarded", he is "diagnosed" with ADD, which relieves him of the responsibility to do any homework. Soon the rest of the class manages to get diagnosed with ADD, and all get prescribed Ritalin. Everyone is on Ritalin and just complacent enough to sit through a Phil Collins show.
episodes.title: Timmy 2000

episodes.label: 4x04. Quintuplets 2000
episodes.plot: The boys discover 8-year-old contorting quintuplets from Romania. Cartman decides to stage his own performance. The quintuplets and their grandmother defect from Romania and wind up staying at the Marsh's home. Thanks to Grandpa Marsh the girls' grandmother gets "loved to death." The girl's father is brought in by the Romanian government to demand his daughters back, Janet Reno to the rescue!
episodes.title: Quintuplets 2000

episodes.label: 4x05. Cartman Joins NAMBLA
episodes.plot: Cartman decides to seek the friendship of older men. Using the Internet, he makes a connection with men who love to hang out with little boys. An organization called NAMBLA (North American Man Boy Love Association) holds a meeting in South Park and Cartman becomes their poster child. The boys learn how much an adult can really love a child.
episodes.title: Cartman Joins NAMBLA

episodes.label: 1x01. Pilot
episodes.plot: Harvey throws Mike his first case, a ''pro bono'' sexual harassment suit involving a CEO. But will Mike's need to raise twenty-five thousand dollars and his ''bad influence'' best friend get in his way? If Harvey is going to stay on top of his game, he'll have to keep Mike motivated and honest.
episodes.title: Pilot

episodes.label: 1x02. Errors and Omissions
episodes.plot: Mike has an ethical dilemma when Louis forces him to make a decision that could hurt his relationship with Harvey. Elsewhere, Harvey's past comes back to haunt him during a case.
episodes.title: Errors and Omissions

episodes.label: 1x03. Inside Track
episodes.plot: Jessica hopes Harvey's promotion will reign him in, but when a crisis arises with the first client he brought into the firm, Harvey goes rogue trying to fix it.
episodes.title: Inside Track

episodes.label: 1x04. Dirty Little Secrets
episodes.plot: Harvey and Jessica's relationship is tested when Harvey defends someone from her past. Also, Louis assigns Mike his first solo case, a pro bono that has him itching for a win.
episodes.title: Dirty Little Secrets

episodes.label: 1x05. Bail Out
episodes.plot: Mike's life becomes complicated when an old friend reappears and needs his help. Harvey must decide between closing a multi-million dollar deal and helping his trusted driver defend himself against a law suit.
episodes.title: Bail Out

episodes.label: 2x01. She Knows
episodes.plot: Oblivious of the fact that Trevor approached Jessica, Mike's on top of the world after Harvey entrusts him with closing a major lawsuit for the firm.
episodes.title: She Knows

episodes.label: 2x02. The Choice
episodes.plot: As Hardman makes it clear he's back to stay, Jessica tasks Harvey with helping shore up support for her within the firm - but Harvey's penchant for winning may create more enemies than friends.
episodes.title: The Choice

episodes.label: 2x03. Meet the New Boss
episodes.plot: Harvey bristles at Daniel's involvement on a lawsuit he's handling, but their battle to one up each other threatens the case, leaving Mike caught in the middle.
episodes.title: Meet the New Boss

episodes.label: 2x04. Discovery
episodes.plot: Louis and Mike finally see eye to eye, but Louis' paranoia may damage his budding friendship with Mike as well as his standing at the firm. Also, Travis Tanner rolls back into town, gunning for Harvey. Guest Stars: Eric Close, David Costabile, John Finn.
episodes.title: Discovery

episodes.label: 2x05. Break Point
episodes.plot: Harvey balks when Jessica puts him in the passenger seat on a lawsuit that could make or break the firm, and his backseat driving may have far-reaching consequences.
episodes.title: Break Point

episodes.label: 3x01. The Arrangement
episodes.plot: The merger complete, Jessica's new partnership with Darby is tested when he assigns Harvey a high-profile client, an oil baroness named Ava Hessington, who has a deeper past with Darby than originally thought. Mike works to reconcile with Harvey, while also trying to manage the fallout from his revelation to Rachel. Meanwhile, Louis convinces Darby to give him quartermaster responsibilities at the firm over his rival, Nigel, but the move backfires when Nigel is put in charge of something even more precious to Louis.
episodes.title: The Arrangement

episodes.label: 3x02. I Want You to Want Me
episodes.plot: Louis offers Mike a case and partnership that could change his future at the firm. Harvey and Jessica team up to keep Ava Hessington out of jail, but their case is complicated by an old nemesis of Harvey's, disgraced former DA Cameron Dennis.
episodes.title: I Want You to Want Me

episodes.label: 3x03. Unfinished Business
episodes.plot: Cameron has Harvey's client arrested for murder. Meanwhile, Katrina tries to win over Louis and a British version of Harvey arrives at the firm.
episodes.title: Unfinished Business

episodes.label: 3x04. Conflict of Interest
episodes.plot: Harvey’s defense of Ava hits a roadblock when the interests of her murder trial are at odds with Louis’ work to thwart a hostile takeover of Hessington Oil by a rival businessman.
episodes.title: Conflict of Interest

episodes.label: 3x05. Shadow of a Doubt
episodes.plot: Lines between the personal and the professional get blurred when Harvey and Stephen work together on Ava's case, and Mike invites Rachel to join him on a case that gets complicated when his secret falls in the line of fire -- with Rachel's parents.
episodes.title: Shadow of a Doubt

episodes.label: 4x01. One-Two-Three Go...
episodes.plot: Mike and Harvey adjust to their new paradigm. As they butt heads over strategy in Mike’s first foray into investment banking, their new attorney-client relationship may be short-lived. Meanwhile, Pearson Specter discovers that a disgraced former District Attorney may be pursuing a vendetta against Harvey and the firm.
episodes.title: One-Two-Three Go...

episodes.label: 4x02. Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner
episodes.plot: Harvey and Mike find themselves on opposite sides of a takeover battle that threatens to turn into a knockdown, drag-out fight – a fight complicated by Rachel’s relationship with Mike. Meanwhile, Louis finds himself partnered with recent SEC defector Jeff Malone in defending Pearson Specter from disgraced DA Eric Woodall.
episodes.title: Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner

episodes.label: 4x03. Two in the Knees
episodes.plot: Pearson Specter’s client, Logan Sanders, pushes Harvey to prove his relationship with Mike won’t hinder him from doing what it takes to win their takeover battle. Meanwhile, Louis attempts to mend his relationship with new colleague Jeff Malone, but their ensuing bonding leads to some misunderstandings.
episodes.title: Two in the Knees

episodes.label: 4x04. Leveraged
episodes.plot: Having lost his partner on the inside, Mike moves to a hostile takeover of Gillis Industries. On the other side, Harvey and Louis pull out all the stops to make sure they win this takeover fight, and things take a personal turn. Meanwhile, Jessica and Malone come face-to-face with Sean Cahill, the attack dog with the weight of the SEC behind him, bent on bringing The Firm down.
episodes.title: Leveraged

episodes.label: 4x05. Pound of Flesh
episodes.plot: Rachel becomes increasingly anxious about work, school, and the growing attraction between herself and Pearson Specter client Logan Sanders. Meanwhile, Louis helps Donna prepare for a major role while she encourages him to face his fear. Harvey and Mike agree to a ceasefire, but Sam accuses him of collusion and Mike learns how ruthless his new partner can be.
episodes.title: Pound of Flesh

episodes.label: 1x01. Pilot
episodes.plot: Brilliant physicist roommates Leonard and Sheldon meet their new neighbor Penny, who begins showing them that as much as they know about science, they know little about actual living.
episodes.title: Pilot

episodes.label: 1x02. The Big Bran Hypothesis
episodes.plot: Leonard volunteers to sign for a package in an attempt to make a good impression on Penny, but when he enlists Sheldon for help, his attempt at chivalry goes terribly awry.
episodes.title: The Big Bran Hypothesis

episodes.label: 1x03. The Fuzzy Boots Corollary
episodes.plot: Leonard asks a woman out after he finds out that Penny is seeing someone.
episodes.title: The Fuzzy Boots Corollary

episodes.label: 1x04. The Luminous Fish Effect
episodes.plot: Sheldon's getting fired forces him to explore what life has to offer outside physics, leaving Leonard to take drastic action to snap his friend out of his funk.
episodes.title: The Luminous Fish Effect

episodes.label: 1x05. The Hamburger Postulate
episodes.plot: Fearing he's wasting his time on Penny, Leonard ends up making a connection with Leslie.
episodes.title: The Hamburger Postulate

episodes.label: 2x01. The Bad Fish Paradigm
episodes.plot: Penny's first date with Leonard goes awry; Penny finds Sheldon to be an unwilling confidant.
episodes.title: The Bad Fish Paradigm

episodes.label: 2x02. The Codpiece Topology
episodes.plot: A jealous Leonard reacts to Penny's new guy by rebounding with Leslie.
episodes.title: The Codpiece Topology

episodes.label: 2x03. The Barbarian Sublimation
episodes.plot: Sheldon creates a monster when he introduces Penny to online gaming.
episodes.title: The Barbarian Sublimation

episodes.label: 2x04. The Griffin Equivalency
episodes.plot: Raj gets an inflated ego and makes a play for Penny after being referenced in a magazine article.
episodes.title: The Griffin Equivalency

episodes.label: 2x05. The Euclid Alternative
episodes.plot: Leonard and his friends stage an intervention to force Sheldon to face his fear of driving.
episodes.title: The Euclid Alternative

episodes.label: 3x01. The Electric Can Opener Fluctuation
episodes.plot: When Sheldon learns the guys tampered with his expedition data he got from the arctic, he leaves to Texas in disgrace. This results in the guys following him, which threatens Leonard's hope for some romantic time with Penny and the guys' friendship with Sheldon.
episodes.title: The Electric Can Opener Fluctuation

episodes.label: 3x02. The Jiminy Conjecture
episodes.plot: Leonard and Penny struggle to recover from an awkward first hookup while Sheldon and Howard stake their best comic books on a bet to determine the species of a cricket.
episodes.title: The Jiminy Conjecture

episodes.label: 3x03. The Gothowitz Deviation
episodes.plot: Howard and Raj visit a Goth nightclub to pick up women while Sheldon attempts to build a better Penny using chocolate-based behavior modification.
episodes.title: The Gothowitz Deviation

episodes.label: 3x04. The Pirate Solution
episodes.plot: Raj must find a new job or be sent back to India, but Sheldon has a solution, which leaves Leonard and Penny dealing with Howard as a third wheel.
episodes.title: The Pirate Solution

episodes.label: 3x05. The Creepy Candy Coating Corollary
episodes.plot: After overhearing that Wil Wheaton is entering a trading-card competition, Sheldon decides to enter it himself. Meanwhile, Penny sets up one of her friends on a date with Wolowitz.
episodes.title: The Creepy Candy Coating Corollary

episodes.label: 4x01. The Robotic Manipulation
episodes.plot: Penny tags along on Sheldon's first ever date; Wolowitz finds a new use for a robotic arm.
episodes.title: The Robotic Manipulation

episodes.label: 4x02. The Cruciferous Vegetable Amplification
episodes.plot: Realizing he will not live long enough to download his consciousness into a robot body, Sheldon tries to extend his life span.
episodes.title: The Cruciferous Vegetable Amplification

episodes.label: 4x03. The Zazzy Substitution
episodes.plot: The guys are concerned as Sheldon searches for an alternative to human companionship.
episodes.title: The Zazzy Substitution

episodes.label: 4x04. The Hot Troll Deviation
episodes.plot: An embarrassing secret of Wolowitz's comes to light, while Sheldon and Raj have a small war at work.
episodes.title: The Hot Troll Deviation

episodes.label: 4x05. The Desperation Emanation
episodes.plot: Leonard realizes he’s the only one without a girlfriend, while Sheldon wants to get rid of his.
episodes.title: The Desperation Emanation

episodes.label: 1x01. Simpsons Roasting on an Open Fire
episodes.plot: When his Christmas bonus is cancelled, Homer becomes a department-store Santa--and then bets his meager earnings at the track. When all seems lost, Homer and Bart save Christmas by adopting the losing greyhound, Santa's Little Helper.
episodes.title: Simpsons Roasting on an Open Fire

episodes.label: 1x02. Bart the Genius
episodes.plot: After switching IQ tests with Martin, Bart is mistaken for a child genius. When he's enrolled in a school for gifted students, a series of embarrassments and mishaps makes him long for his old life.
episodes.title: Bart the Genius

episodes.label: 1x03. Homer's Odyssey
episodes.plot: Homer is fired for nearly causing a meltdown at the nuclear plant. When he finds a new calling as a public safety advocate, he finds himself facing off against Mr. Burns.
episodes.title: Homer's Odyssey

episodes.label: 1x04. There's No Disgrace Like Home
episodes.plot: After an embarrassing experience at the company picnic, Homer pawns the TV and uses the proceeds to take the family to therapy sessions.
episodes.title: There's No Disgrace Like Home

episodes.label: 1x05. Bart the General
episodes.plot: Fed up with Nelson's bullying, the kids from Springfield Elementary decide to teach him a lesson. With advice from Grandpa, Bart leads them into battle.
episodes.title: Bart the General

episodes.label: 2x01. Bart Gets an F
episodes.plot: In danger of flunking the fourth grade, Bart strikes a deal with the class brain: in exchange for tutoring, he will help Martin become more popular.
episodes.title: Bart Gets an F

episodes.label: 2x02. Simpson and Delilah
episodes.plot: After Homer charges a miracle hair growth treatment to the company's health insurance, his new found confidence gets him a promotion.
episodes.title: Simpson and Delilah

episodes.label: 2x03. Treehouse of Horror
episodes.plot: In the first segment, the family moves into a haunted mansion. In the second segment, aliens abduct the Simpsons and invite them to what might be their last supper. In the final segment, Lisa reads Bart Edgar Allan Poe's classic poem "The Raven."
episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror

episodes.label: 2x04. Two Cars in Every Garage and Three Eyes on Every Fish
episodes.plot: When a three-eyed fish is found in a nearby stream, the Springfield Nuclear Power Plant faces bad publicity and fails an inspection. Mr. Burns runs for governor, but his spin doctors are no match for Marge.
episodes.title: Two Cars in Every Garage and Three Eyes on Every Fish

episodes.label: 2x05. Dancin' Homer
episodes.plot: Homer becomes a local celebrity as the Springfield Isotopes' mascot. When he's promoted to the big leagues, the family moves to Capital City.
episodes.title: Dancin' Homer

episodes.label: 3x01. Stark Raving Dad
episodes.plot: Mistakenly committed to a mental hospital, Homer meets a tall, stocky white man who claims to be Michael Jackson.
episodes.title: Stark Raving Dad

episodes.label: 3x02. Mr. Lisa Goes to Washington
episodes.plot: Lisa’s patriotic essay wins the family a trip to Washington, D.C. -- but the corruption she sees there inspires her to write a new and very different essay.
episodes.title: Mr. Lisa Goes to Washington

episodes.label: 3x03. When Flanders Failed
episodes.plot: When Ned Flanders opens a store for left-handed people, Homer wants him to fail... until he sees the downtrodden Flanders family living in their car.
episodes.title: When Flanders Failed

episodes.label: 3x04. Bart the Murderer
episodes.plot: Bart becomes an errand boy for the Springfield Mafia. When Principal Skinner disappears, Fat Tony points the finger at Bart.
episodes.title: Bart the Murderer

episodes.label: 3x05. Homer Defined
episodes.plot: Homer averts a meltdown through sheer dumb luck. When he’s invited to the Shelbyville Nuclear Power Plant to give a pep talk, he faces another potential meltdown and again “pulls a Homer.”
episodes.title: Homer Defined

episodes.label: 4x01. Kamp Krusty
episodes.plot: When Bart and Lisa arrive at Kamp Krusty, they find the summer camp is more like a prison camp. When Krusty doesn't show up to set things straight, the kids seize control and take their case to the media.
episodes.title: Kamp Krusty

episodes.label: 4x02. A Streetcar Named Marge
episodes.plot: Feeling underappreciated at home, Marge takes up acting and channels her pent-up rage as Blanche DuBois in a community production. Meanwhile, Maggie leads a revolt at the Ayn Rand School for Tots.
episodes.title: A Streetcar Named Marge

episodes.label: 4x03. Homer the Heretic
episodes.plot: After skipping church one Sunday morning, Homer decides to quit church altogether and spend Sundays worshiping in his own way -- with cigars and beer.
episodes.title: Homer the Heretic

episodes.label: 4x04. Lisa the Beauty Queen
episodes.plot: Homer enters Lisa into the Little Miss Springfield Pageant to help her feel better about her looks. But when she must choose between the title and her integrity, she realizes that confidence comes from within.
episodes.title: Lisa the Beauty Queen

episodes.label: 4x05. Treehouse of Horror III
episodes.plot: In "Clown Without Pity," Bart's Krusty doll is determined to murder Homer. In "King Homer," Homer plays King Kong to Marge's Fay Wray. Finally, in "Dial Z for Zombies," Bart finds a book of witchcraft and accidentally brings Springfield's dead to life.
episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror III

episodes.label: 1x01. Days Gone Bye
episodes.plot: Rick searches for his family after emerging from a coma into a world terrorized by the walking dead. Morgan and Duane, whom he meets along the way, help teach Rick the new rules for survival.
episodes.title: Days Gone Bye

episodes.label: 1x02. Guts
episodes.plot: Rick unknowingly causes a group of survivors to be trapped by walkers. The group dynamic devolves from accusations to violence, as Rick must confront an enemy far more dangerous than the undead.
episodes.title: Guts

episodes.label: 1x03. Tell It to the Frogs
episodes.plot: After returning to the camp with the department store survivors and an emotional reunion with his wife and son, Rick decides to go against Shane's advice and go back to Atlanta for Merle Dixon and his dropped bag of guns accompanied by Merle's younger brother, Darryl Dixon, as well as Glenn and T-Dog.
episodes.title: Tell It to the Frogs

episodes.label: 1x04. Vatos
episodes.plot: While still in search of Merle, the group tries to retrieve the bag of guns but are attacked by several living men who are also after the weapons. The group manages to grab the injured attacker; however, several of the attackers escape and take Glenn hostage. Back at camp a large group of walkers venture up the hill and take the survivors by surprise.
episodes.title: Vatos

episodes.label: 1x05. Wildfire
episodes.plot: Rick leads the group to the CDC after the attack on the camp. Jim must make a terrible life and death decision.
episodes.title: Wildfire

episodes.label: 2x01. What Lies Ahead
episodes.plot: Rick and the group leave Atlanta and encounter a threat on the highway the likes of which they've never seen. Elsewhere, the group search for a missing person.
episodes.title: What Lies Ahead

episodes.label: 2x02. Bloodletting
episodes.plot: Rick discovers a possible safe haven. Shane must go on a dangerous mission to get needed medical supplies.
episodes.title: Bloodletting

episodes.label: 2x03. Save the Last One
episodes.plot: The group desperately awaits Shane's return. Shane finds himself trapped in a school, surrounded by the undead. Daryl and Andrea search for someone in the woods.
episodes.title: Save the Last One

episodes.label: 2x04. Cherokee Rose
episodes.plot: Shane makes a deadly sacrifice which leads to unusual behavior and self-distancing. The rest of the group tries to hang on somewhere between living to die and dying to live.
episodes.title: Cherokee Rose

episodes.label: 2x05. Chupacabra
episodes.plot: Concerned for their safety, the group makes a plan – one that Hershel disagrees with adamantly. He makes it clear the group is fine to stay for now, but not indefinitely.
episodes.title: Chupacabra

episodes.label: 3x01. Seed
episodes.plot: As the world grows more dangerous and Lori's pregnancy advances, Rick locates a potentially safe haven.
episodes.title: Seed

episodes.label: 3x02. Sick
episodes.plot: A life hangs in the balance; the group deals with a threat to their new surroundings.
episodes.title: Sick

episodes.label: 3x03. Walk with Me
episodes.plot: After witnessing an accident, Andrea and Michonne are introduced to a new community of survivors. As conflicts arise with their new acquaintances, a decision must be made.
episodes.title: Walk with Me

episodes.label: 3x04. Killer Within
episodes.plot: The group is severed, placing lives in jeopardy. Merle has a request for the Governor. Meanwhile the prison doesn't seem to be a place as secure as they thought.
episodes.title: Killer Within

episodes.label: 3x05. Say the Word
episodes.plot: Rick struggles after another loss. Michonne is suspicious of the Governor.
episodes.title: Say the Word

episodes.label: 4x01. 30 Days Without an Accident
episodes.plot: Rick and the group are as close to an ideal life as possible at the prison. Will they be able to hold on to humanity in the face of a new evil?
episodes.title: 30 Days Without an Accident

episodes.label: 4x02. Infected
episodes.plot: As the group faces a brand new enemy, Rick and the others must fight to protect the livelihood they worked so hard to create at the prison.
episodes.title: Infected

episodes.label: 4x03. Isolation
episodes.plot: As one group leaves the prison in search for supplies at a local college, those who stay must deal with recent losses while preserving what remains.
episodes.title: Isolation

episodes.label: 4x04. Indifference
episodes.plot: While on a supplies mission to a local college, members of the group run into multiple hurdles. Things at the prison are getting worse.
episodes.title: Indifference

episodes.label: 4x05. Internment
episodes.plot: Multiple enemies put pressure on Rick and the group. Could this finally be the breaking point for the survivors and the prison?
episodes.title: Internment

episodes.label: 1x01. Pilot (Most Chicks Won't Eat Veal)
episodes.plot: Charlie's life turns upside down when his brother and nephew move in; at the supermarket, Charlie discovers he can use 10-year-old Jake to attract women.
episodes.title: Pilot (Most Chicks Won't Eat Veal)

episodes.label: 1x02. Big Flappy Bastards
episodes.plot:
While spending time with Jake, Charlie finds it hard to enforce rules that Alan has set out for him.  It gets to the point were Jake lures a flock of sea gulls into his room, and Charlie gets very upset.  This prompts Jake to try and get Charlie to forgive him.
Alan starts doing chores for Judith, in the hopes of them getting back together.  During one of the tasks, Judith kisses Alan, leading him to believe that things will get back to the way they once were.
episodes.title: Big Flappy Bastards

episodes.label: 1x03. Go East on Sunset Until You Reach the Gates of Hell
episodes.plot: After spending a day at Disneyland, Jake gets sick and wants to go to his mothers' house, to have her take care of him.  This sends Alan into a state of misery, as he realizes he's losing his wife, and son.  Charlie suggests that they go drinking, and Alan agrees. After drinking the boys take a cab home, but at one point they end up at their mothers, where they try to tell her what they think of her, but fail in getting the point across.
episodes.title: Go East on Sunset Until You Reach the Gates of Hell

episodes.label: 1x04. If I Can't Write My Chocolate Song, I'm Going to Take a Nap
episodes.plot: Charlie is very unhappy with his housekeepers' decision to quit, after she experiences Alan's demanding ways. Alan then offers to take on the role of housekeeper, but this situation doesn't work at all. So Alan decides to get the housekeeper to come back. Before Alan leaves, he puts Charlie in charge of getting Jake ready for a dinner with his mother and grandparents. Charlie also tries to get Rose to move on, and date other men. He finds both situations to be bigger challenges then he first thought.
episodes.title: If I Can't Write My Chocolate Song, I'm Going to Take a Nap

episodes.label: 1x05. The Last Thing You Want to Do Is Wind Up with a Hump
episodes.plot: After spending a night in Las Vegas, Charlie decides to live up to his promise that he made to Jake about attending his soccer game.  During the game, Charlie sets up a play-date with an unattached mother named Kate, and they hit it off.  During one of their dates, Charlie seems like he's ready for a serious relation.    Alan sets up a meeting with Gloria (one of the soccer moms) to write a soccer newsletter, but Gloria has other intentions for the evening, and he has no idea.  During the evening another soccer mom, Brooke, tries to move in on Gloria's plans.
episodes.title: The Last Thing You Want to Do Is Wind Up with a Hump

episodes.label: 2x01. Back Off, Mary Poppins
episodes.plot: Alan learns that Charlie belongs to an exclusive men's group, and he begs his brother to let him join.
episodes.title: Back Off, Mary Poppins

episodes.label: 2x02. Enjoy Those Garlic Balls
episodes.plot: Judith is dating Jake's pediatrician, and Alan is upset until Charlie points out that if she remarries, his alimony payments will end.
episodes.title: Enjoy Those Garlic Balls

episodes.label: 2x03. A Bag Full of Jawea
episodes.plot: Charlie tries to save Jake from school suspension for giving his teacher (Missi Pyle) the finger by romancing her, but his several attempts fail every time.
episodes.title: A Bag Full of Jawea

episodes.label: 2x04. Go Get Mommy's Bra
episodes.plot: Jake is very impressed and can't stop talking about his mother's new boyfriend, Dr. Melnick, which annoys Alan.   While Evelyn borrows Charlie's car to help her impress a Saudi prince, because she wants to sell him real estate.  When Charlie gets his car back, he discovers his mother's bra in the backseat.  When he finds out why it's there he decides to trade in his car.
episodes.title: Go Get Mommy's Bra

episodes.label: 2x05. Bad News from the Clinic?
episodes.plot: Charlie meets his match when he falls for a woman who's better at playing hard to get than he is.
episodes.title: Bad News from the Clinic?

episodes.label: 3x01. Weekend In Bangkok with Two Olympic Gymnasts
episodes.plot: After falling off the roof, Alan needs Charlie's help in looking after Jake, which interferes with Charlie's social life.
episodes.title: Weekend In Bangkok with Two Olympic Gymnasts

episodes.label: 3x02. Principal Gallagher's Lesbian Lover
episodes.plot: Jake gets suspended from school after drawing an offensive picture of a girl in his class that has large breasts. Meanwhile, Charlie is asked to watch over Alan's chiropractic office after pulling an all-nighter.
episodes.title: Principal Gallagher's Lesbian Lover

episodes.label: 3x03. Carpet Burns and a Bite Mark
episodes.plot: Alan has been dating a lot, and Charlie soon finds out that it has been one woman - his ex-wife, Judith. He tries to stop Alan, and even brings Rose, Evelyn and Berta to interfere - but Alan ignores them all.
episodes.title: Carpet Burns and a Bite Mark

episodes.label: 3x04. Your Dismissive Attitude Toward Boobs
episodes.plot: Berta causes tension between Charlie and Alan, when she temporarily moves in with them
episodes.title: Your Dismissive Attitude Toward Boobs

episodes.label: 3x05. We Called It Mr. Pinky
episodes.plot: Charlie learns he can't be in a long-lasting relationship, becuase of unresolved issues he has with his mother. Jake asks Charlie for advice about a girl at school.
episodes.title: We Called It Mr. Pinky

episodes.label: 4x01. Working for Caligula
episodes.plot: Charlie returns to his bachelor lifestyle after Alan moves out of the house. Alan suffers a breakdown after his divorce from Kandi.
episodes.title: Working for Caligula

episodes.label: 4x02. Who's Vod Kanockers?
episodes.plot: Charlie finally tells Alan the truth about why he did not marry Mia. Charlie and Alan deal with a noisy neighbour.
episodes.title: Who's Vod Kanockers?

episodes.label: 4x03. The Sea Is a Harsh Mistress
episodes.plot: Charlie tries to surf to impress Dottie, a beautiful woman he just met, but after he nearly drowns he is convinced that he saw his late father.
episodes.title: The Sea Is a Harsh Mistress

episodes.label: 4x04. A Pot Smoking Monkey
episodes.plot: Alan tries to hire his ex-wife's lawyer to help him win custody over the dog he and Kandi shared.
episodes.title: A Pot Smoking Monkey

episodes.label: 4x05. A Live Woman of Proven Fertility
episodes.plot: Alan is overjoyed by the prospect of Judith remarrying, as he would no longer have to pay alimony. Alan gets Charlie to help him when it looks like the marriage may be derailed due to Jake’s dislike of his mother’s fiancé.
episodes.title: A Live Woman of Proven Fertility

episodes.label: 1x01. Chapter 1
episodes.plot: When the newly elected President reneges on a promise, Francis and Claire decide to sever all allegiances and toss the rules out the window.
episodes.title: Chapter 1

episodes.label: 1x02. Chapter 2
episodes.plot: Francis and Doug plan to frame Secretary of State nominee, Michael Kern. Meanwhile, Zoe's popularity at the Washington Herald continues to grow.
episodes.title: Chapter 2

episodes.label: 1x03. Chapter 3
episodes.plot: Francis heads for his hometown to deal with a crisis. Zoe negotiates the politics of being a journalist on the rise. Claire finds herself a new business partner.
episodes.title: Chapter 3

episodes.label: 1x04. Chapter 4
episodes.plot: Francis shakes down the Congressional leadership. Zoe is offered the promotion of White House Correspondent and doesn't know if she should take it or not.
episodes.title: Chapter 4

episodes.label: 1x05. Chapter 5
episodes.plot: A feud starts between Francis and Marty Spinella. Russo goes into depression about the job losses at the shipyards.
episodes.title: Chapter 5

episodes.label: 2x01. Chapter 14
episodes.plot: The Underwoods tackle two threats that could bring their plans to ruin. Francis grooms his replacement as Whip. Claire goes on the offensive.
episodes.title: Chapter 14

episodes.label: 2x02. Chapter 15
episodes.plot: Amid turmoil in the home, Frank takes office. Foreign relations become entangled as Durant's team bungles a meeting. As foes negotiate to thwart her, Jackie maneuvers to strengthen her position. Lucas acquires new skills in order to pursue his secret investigation.
episodes.title: Chapter 15

episodes.label: 2x03. Chapter 16
episodes.plot: Tension rises between Francis and Raymond Tusk as the situation with China deteriorates. A battle in the Senate pits Francis against the Republicans.
episodes.title: Chapter 16

episodes.label: 2x04. Chapter 17
episodes.plot: A terror scare at the Capitol traps Francis with a resentful Donald Blythe. Claire gives a live interview that rocks the media.
episodes.title: Chapter 17

episodes.label: 2x05. Chapter 18
episodes.plot: Francis back-channels with a Chinese billionaire. Lucas uses extreme measures to expose the Vice President. A shadowy figure joins Team Underwood.
episodes.title: Chapter 18

episodes.label: 3x01. Chapter 27
episodes.plot: A rocky start for the Underwood Presidency. Frank wants to introduce an ambitious jobs program, while Claire sets her sights on the United Nations.
episodes.title: Chapter 27

episodes.label: 3x02. Chapter 28
episodes.plot: Claire's U.N. bid runs into trouble. Frank fights off mutiny with a bold address to the country.
episodes.title: Chapter 28

episodes.label: 3x03. Chapter 29
episodes.plot: The Russian president's state visit becomes a cold war of wills, and some punks heat things up.
episodes.title: Chapter 29

episodes.label: 3x04. Chapter 30
episodes.plot: Claire bypasses Russia at the U.N. Frank tries to outmaneuver a potential challenger and ends up face to face with a higher power.
episodes.title: Chapter 30

episodes.label: 3x05. Chapter 31
episodes.plot: Frank declares war on Congress to jump-start his jobs program. Claire spars with the Russian Ambassador.
episodes.title: Chapter 31

episodes.label: 4x01. Chapter 40
episodes.plot: Claire's absence causes problems for Frank on the campaign trail amid rumors of a marital rift. Claire tries to strike out on her own.
episodes.title: Chapter 40

episodes.label: 4x02. Chapter 41
episodes.plot: As Claire begins exploring a campaign of her own, she and Frank engage in backdoor political maneuvering. But this time they're not on the same side.
episodes.title: Chapter 41

episodes.label: 4x03. Chapter 42
episodes.plot: Claire joins Frank as he stumps in South Carolina, but he doesn't trust her. A disastrous scandal blindsides Frank's campaign on primary day.
episodes.title: Chapter 42

episodes.label: 4x04. Chapter 43
episodes.plot: Claire threatens Frank. Frank makes a politically bold move that may provoke Russia. An event at a campaign stop changes everything.
episodes.title: Chapter 43

episodes.label: 4x05. Chapter 44
episodes.plot: Claire advises Donald Blythe on dealing with Petrov. Further investigations of Lucas Goodwin dredges up his accusations against Frank.
episodes.title: Chapter 44
